title: 'He Was Seen At Funeral': Murdered Man's Mother On His Wife's Alleged Lover
content: Raja Raghuvanshi and Sonam Raghuvanshi left for Meghalaya on their honeymoon on May 20, nine days after their May 11 wedding in Indore. On May 23, they went missing hours after they checked out of a homestay in Nongriat village.

title: Will You Go To Hospital And Apologise To That Doctor? What Goa Minister Told NDTV
content: Vishwajit Rane, the health minister of Goa who stirred up controversy after suspending a doctor over patient care and then apologising, said he would not apologise again.

title: Rebel Uncle, Rebel Nephew: Tale Of 2 NCP Foundation Day Events In Pune
content: The contrasting scenes at Bal Gandharva Rang Mandir and Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Sports Complex in Pune reflect the mood and political positioning of both factions in the state.

title: Massive Drug Bust Worth Over Rs 55 Crore In Manipur's Churachandpur
content: Continuing the battle against smuggling and trafficking of contraband drugs in the northeastern region, a joint team in Manipur has seized nearly 8 kg of heroin worth Rs 54.29 crore and 6.7 kg of opium valued at Rs 87.57 lakh.

title: Honeymoon Murder: Wife Surrenders After Husband's Murder, Indore Couple Had Gone Missing in Meghalaya
content: Meghalaya Honeymoon Murder Case Live: Sonam had reportedly gone missing after her husband's body was discovered in a gorge beneath the Weisawdong Falls parking lot in East Khasi Hills on June 2.

title: "Sonam Claimed She Was Drugged, Brought To UP": Top Cop On Honeymoon Murder
content: Sonam Raghuvanshi was arrested for allegedly killing her husband, Raja Raghuvanshi, when the newly married couple were on their honeymoon in Meghalaya.

title: Sonam Raghuvanshi's Aide Took People To Husband's Funeral In Indore
content: One of the persons arrested for alleged involvement in the murder of Indore-based Raja Raghuvanshi in Meghalaya had taken people to the latter's funeral, an eyewitness said.

title: Aviation Regulator DGCA Orders Audit Of Helicopter Services In Uttarakhand
content: Aviation safety regulator Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has ordered special audits/enhanced surveillance into helicopter operations involved in shuttle services in Uttarakhand.

title: Survivors Of Sex Assault Kill Accused In Odisha, Burn His Body
content: A group of women, who were allegedly sexually assaulted by a 60-year-old man over a period of time, killed him and burnt his body in Odisha's Gajapati district.

title: Drunk Man Tries To Jump Into Girlfriend's Pyre, Thrashed By Funeral Attendees
content: An inebriated man tried to jump into the pyre of his 19-year-old girlfriend, who had died by suicide, prompting those at the funeral to thrash him.

title: Mpox Is Still A Health Emergency, Says WHO
content: The mpox outbreak is still a public health emergency, the World Health Organization said on Monday, with the health body's director-general issuing a revised set of temporary recommendations.

title: "Enjoy The Ride": Astronaut Community Send Wishes To Shubhanshu Shukla
content: India will take its cosmic leap of faith on June 11 when Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla will lift off for the International Space Station for the Axiom-4 mission, becoming the second Indian in 41 years to fly to space.

title: "Incompetent, Liar": Trump As California Governor Plans To Sue Him Amid Protest
content: Gavin Newsom, the Governor of California, announced on Monday that he plans to sue the President over his administration's crackdown over protests that have rocked Los Angeles over the last 72 hours.

title: Video: Cobra Swallows 1-Foot Long Knife. Here's How They Took It Out
content: A cobra entered a home in search of prey. The venomous reptile crawled through the kitchen when it accidentally swallowed a knife, mistaking it for food. It was far from anything a snake would digest.

title: Chhattisgarh Cop Dies, Two Officers Injured In Landmine Blast In Sukma
content: In one of the most devastating Maoist attacks in recent times, Additional Superintendent of Police Akash Rao Girpunje died and two other senior police officers seriously injured after a pressure IED blast rocked Chhattisgarh's Sukma district today.

title: The 3rd UN Ocean Conference: Why India, World Can't Ignore It
content: What do a fisherman in Kerala, a scuba diver off the coast of the Andamans, and a child building sandcastles on Juhu Beach have in common? They all depend on healthy oceans - whether for food, income, wonder, or simply joy.

title: 'Don't Want Compensation, Just Want Him Back': Man Seen Crying Over Son's Grave
content: A father wailing while clinging to his 21-year-old son's grave has become the grim face of a celebration that turned to tragedy in Bengaluru. His son, Bhumik, was among the 11 people who were killed in the stampede on June 4.

title: Lucknow Prepares To Celebrate Local Boy's Historic Space Mission
content: Lucknow will cheer for Group Captain Shubhanshu 'Shux' Shukla when he embarks on a historic journey to the ISS, with his alma mater - City Montessori School - organising a grand public watch party.

title: Thane Man Ignored Friend's Advice To Stand Near Train Door, That Probably Saved Him
content: Dipak Shirsat, a resident of Ulhasnagar in Maharashtra's Thane district, did not pay heed to his friend's advice to stand near the footboard of an overcrowded local train and that probably saved his life.

title: Axiom-4 mission: Shubhanshu Shukla's launch to space pushed back by a day
content: SpaceX has postponed the Axiom-4 mission, which includes India’s Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, to June 11 due to unfavorable weather conditions. The Falcon-9 rocket and Crew Dragon spacecraft are ready at Kennedy Space Centre. ISRO Chairman V Narayanan and a team are in the US for the launch, optimistic about the new date.

title: Meghalaya murder: ‘Happy to marry whoever you choose,' Sonam told her father
content: Sonam Raghuvanshi, now accused of murdering her husband Raja on their honeymoon, had affirmed her consent to the arranged marriage, according to her father. The families, devastated by the tragedy, are struggling to understand her motives. Despite positive feedback and multiple meetings between the families, the seemingly well-matched union ended in unimaginable horror, leaving everyone searching for answers.

title: Amid Bengaluru stampede row, Sidda & DKS summoned to Delhi
content: Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah and DK Shivakumar are summoned to Delhi by Rahul Gandhi for a damage-control meeting following the Bengaluru stampede that killed 11 RCB fans. The Congress party faces criticism for allegedly shifting blame, prompting the high command to seek a detailed briefing on the administration's response.

title: Govt targeting 2034 to hold 1st 'one nation, one election'
content: India anticipates holding nationwide simultaneous elections by 2034, contingent on the passage of a constitutional amendment. State assemblies elected after 2029 will have shorter terms to align with the 2034 general elections. A joint parliamentary committee is reviewing the 'one nation, one election' bill, potentially extending its tenure to visit states and gather feedback before finalizing recommendations.

title: Army to get new air defence boost with Rs 30,000 crore QR-SAM deal
content: India's defence ministry is set to approve the procurement of indigenous Quick Reaction Surface to Air Missile (QR-SAM) systems for the Army, costing ₹30,000 crore. These highly mobile systems, with a range of 25-30 km, can intercept hostile aerial threats.

title: WWDC 25: iOS 26 announced; All the new features coming to iPhones
content: Apple unveiled iOS 26 at WWDC 2025, a significant update featuring a 'Liquid Glass' design for a more translucent interface. Apple Intelligence enhances core apps like Phone and Messages with real-time translation, visual information retrieval, and improved call screening.

title: 'Golden period' or 'only propaganda': BJP, Cong spar as PM Modi's NDA govt marks 11 yrs in office
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi marked 11 years of his government, highlighting India's development under the NDA, guided by "Sabka Saath, Sabka Vikas, Sabka Vishwas, Sabka Prayas." The BJP celebrated this milestone, while the Congress criticized the government, alleging a weakening of constitutional institutions and unfulfilled promises.

title: Techie-lover stabs mom of two to death in Bengaluru hotel room
content: In a tragic turn of events, a 33-year-old woman, Harini R, was murdered by her 25-year-old lover, Yashas, in a Bengaluru hotel. The incident occurred after Harini decided to end their affair. Enraged, Yashas stabbed her multiple times. He later informed the police and attempted self-harm. Yashas has been arrested and is in police custody, while authorities investigate the crime.

title: Meghalaya murder: One of the accused took people to victim Raja's funeral, eyewitness says
content: In a shocking turn of events in the Meghalaya honeymoon murder case, one of the arrested suspects, Raj Singh Kushwaha, reportedly drove mourners to the funeral of the victim, Raja Raghuvanshi, in Indore. This revelation came to light after a funeral attendee recognized Kushwaha's photograph following his arrest.

title: WWDC 2025: Apple employee protests during event; unzips his jacket to ....
content: An Apple employee disrupted the WWDC keynote, protesting during Craig Federighi's presentation. The protester displayed a keffiyeh and employee badge while shouting inaudibly before being escorted off stage. This incident follows similar protests at Microsoft's Build conference, highlighting growing internal dissent within tech companies regarding ethical responsibilities. The disruption, captured on video, has sparked discussion on social media.

title: 'LA would have been obliterated': Trump justifies deploying National Guard
content: Donald Trump defended his choice to send National Guard to California due to Los Angeles riots. He criticised Governor Gavin Newscom and Mayor Karen Bass. Protests erupted over Trump's immigration policies, leading to clashes. Demonstrators damaged property and blocked roads. Newsom plans to sue the Trump administration over the deployment. Many arrests happened in Los Angeles. The city faced destruction.

title: “Until we got married”: Kansas City Chief Patrick Mahomes on wife Brittany's support
content: Kansas City Chiefs' star quarterback Patrick Mahomes recently lauded his wife, Brittany, for her unwavering support since their high school days. He credited her for helping him evolve, both on and off the field. Mahomes highlighted Brittany's constant presence and influence, acknowledging her pivotal role in his personal and professional growth.

title: PM Modi to meet delegates who took India's Op Sindoor message to the world
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is scheduled to meet with multi-party delegations on Tuesday, who recently concluded visits to various world capitals to advocate India's stance following Operation Sindoor. These delegations, comprising over 50 members from diverse political affiliations including BJP, Congress, DMK, and AIMIM, will share their insights with PM Modi.

title: Tim Cook recalls Steve Jobs’ lesson: Says Jobs taught him to change mind quickly; Feels thankful
content: Tim Cook credits Steve Jobs with teaching him the invaluable skill of rapidly changing his mind when presented with new evidence, a trait powered by emotional intelligence. Jobs's ability to shift direction and let go of pride influenced Cook and many others, including Jeff Bezos, Jony Ive, and Marc Benioff.

title: Meghalaya murder: 'Wife hired hitmen', say cops; 'Sonam innocent', claims family
content: Sonam Raghuvanshi's father claims her innocence after she was arrested for allegedly hiring people to kill her husband during their honeymoon in Meghalaya. He accuses the Meghalaya Police of fabricating the story and plans to request a CBI inquiry.

title: MS Dhoni inducted into ICC Hall of Fame
content: MS Dhoni, the celebrated former Indian cricket captain, has been inducted into the ICC Cricket Hall of Fame, a testament to his remarkable 16-year international career. He amassed 17,266 runs and 829 dismissals across all formats, revolutionizing the game with his unique style and tactical leadership.

title: No return tickets, sudden plan change: Kin of murdered honeymooner share shocking details
content: The murder of Indore businessman Raja Raghuvanshi in Meghalaya has taken a shocking turn as his mother reveals he was hesitant about the honeymoon. Sonam, his wife, planned the trip but didn't book return tickets, raising suspicions. The family suspects Sonam and her alleged lover, Raj Kushwaha, were involved, especially after Sonam's sudden surrender and the discovery that Raja was carrying valuable jewelry.

title: Ind A vs Eng Lions: KL Rahul hits form with ton and fifty in drawn Test
content: The second unofficial four-day Test between India A and England Lions concluded in a draw at Northampton. India A declared their second innings at 417/7, setting England Lions a target of 439. Tanush Kotian's unbeaten 90 and Anshul Kamboj's 51 led India A's batting effort. England Lions were 32/3 in their second innings.

title: ICC Hall of Fame 2025: Full list of inducted cricketers
content: The ICC inducted seven legends into its Hall of Fame, including MS Dhoni, Matthew Hayden, and Hashim Amla. The ceremony, held at Abbey Road Studios, also honored Graeme Smith, Daniel Vettori, Sana Mir, and Sarah Taylor. ICC Chair Jay Shah celebrated their remarkable contributions, highlighting their impact on cricket's legacy and inspiration to future generations.

title: 'Her emotions were heightened': Taylor distances herself from Blake–Baldoni legal case
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce, despite recent public appearances, navigate the shadow of the Blake Lively-Justin Baldoni legal situation. Sources reveal Kelce is Swift's support system amidst the drama, influencing their preference for Florida's privacy over New York. The couple briefly halted joint appearances post-Super Bowl LIX due to heightened attention.

title: LA burns for 3rd day as anti-immigration protests rage on; Newsom to sue Trump
content: Downtown Los Angeles is facing escalating unrest as protests against President Trump's immigration policies turned violent, leading to clashes between demonstrators and law enforcement. The deployment of the National Guard without the governor's consent has intensified tensions, resulting in numerous arrests and widespread damage. The city is now at a critical juncture, grappling with federal intervention and escalating civil strife.

title: ‘Turnaround story next year’: Paki debt increases to PRs 76,000 bn; FM makes big claims
content: Pakistan's debt has surged to PRs 76,000 billion in the first nine months of the fiscal year. Finance Minister Muhammad Aurangzeb highlights signs of economic recovery and stabilization.

title: Honeymoon murder: Meghalaya Police get 7-day transit custody of Indore bizman's killers
content: Meghalaya Police have secured transit remand for three men accused of murdering an Indore businessman, Raja Raghuvanshi, in Meghalaya. The trio was allegedly hired by Raghuvanshi's wife, Sonam, who later surrendered. The couple had gone to Meghalaya for their honeymoon and were reported missing before Raghuvanshi's body was discovered, prompting a CBI investigation demand.

title: Hate speech case: Man who complained against Sharmistha Panoli held
content: Wazahat Khan Qadri, who filed a complaint against Instagram influencer Sharmistha Panoli, has been arrested. Kolkata Police took action against Qadri following FIRs alleging communal remarks on social media. BJP MLA Agnimitra Paul and Sanjukta Samanta filed the FIRs. Qadri faces multiple complaints, including one with the Lalbazar Cyber Cell. His father claims a witch hunt and denies religious bias.

title: 'Ink of dictatorship ...’: Opposition slams 11 years of Modi government
content: As Narendra Modi's government marked 11 years, the BJP lauded a period of transformation, while opposition parties sharply criticized its performance. Rahul Gandhi attacked the government over the Mumbai railway accident, accusing it of selling dreams. Mallikarjun Kharge alleged the government damaged democracy and the economy.

title: LA riots: American strongman sends troops to quell protests in oppn-ruled California
content: ​Mr Trump – known for strongman-like tendencies like Mr Putin and Mr Jinping – sent in over 2,000 National Guard troops, dressed like Stormtroopers, to quell a popular uprising sparked by workplace raids on labourers who Mr Trump’s officials claim are “illegals” working in America without papers. It was, as one expert put it, a prime example of authoritarian overreach that has become a feature of American autocracy since Mr Trump’s white nationalist Republican Party came to power in the last election.

title: Dipika Kakar emotional as she speaks for first time after surgery; meets family at hospital
content: Dipika Kakar, recovering from stage 2 liver cancer surgery, is now stable and out of the ICU. Her husband, Shoaib Ibrahim, shared a vlog showing Dipika's emotional address to fans, expressing gratitude for their prayers. The family, including their son Ruhaan, visited her in the hospital, boosting her spirits during recovery.

title: ‘Better than US…’: Gadkari's big claim on India’s roads, says ‘main picture yet to start
content: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari asserts that India's road infrastructure will match America's within two years, driven by increased government investment. Ongoing projects include greenfield expressways, port connectivity highways, and religious tourism circuits, alongside developments in tunnels and ropeways.

title: Costume Designer Amritha Ram on designing Kamal Haasan's look in 'Thug Life' - Exclusive
content: Amritha Ram discusses her creative journey designing costumes for Kamal Haasan in Mani Ratnam's 'Thug Life.' She highlights the collaborative process with Ratnam, whose precise vision guided the film's unique aesthetic, diverging from typical commercial styles. Ram details the evolution of Haasan's wardrobe across three distinct stages, emphasizing minimalism and character-driven choices, particularly in the Delhi and Nepal looks.

title: B'luru stampede: Suspended ACP challenges K'taka govt order; moves CAT
content: Senior IPS officer Vikash Kumar Vikash, suspended after a stampede outside Bengaluru's Chinnaswamy Stadium that resulted in 11 fatalities, has challenged his suspension before the Central Administrative Tribunal. The stampede occurred during an event celebrating Royal Challengers Bengaluru's IPL victory, despite police concerns regarding inadequate preparation time. Karnataka's Chief Minister defended the suspensions, citing dereliction of duty.

title: US plane crash: Small aircraft carrying 6 passengers crashes in San Diego
content: A Cessna 414 carrying six individuals crashed into the Pacific Ocean near San Diego shortly after takeoff on Sunday. The US Coast Guard and San Diego Fire-Rescue responded to the incident, locating a debris field off Point Loma in waters approximately 200 feet deep. The plane, en route to Phoenix, went down around 12:30 pm.

title: Explained: How Modi govt pulled 270m out of poverty - what’s the road ahead?
content: The number of people living in extreme poverty in India has dipped to 75.24 million in FY 2022-23 from 344.47 million in FY 2011-12. Incidentally, India’s huge reduction in extreme poverty comes at a time when globally there has been an increase in the number of people below the poverty line.

title: ‘Two maces would be special, but 2023 World Cup tops it’ – Pat Cummins reflects on his legacy
content: Australian captain Pat Cummins regards the 2023 ODI World Cup victory over India as a career highlight. Aiming for consecutive World Test Championship (WTC) titles, Cummins emphasizes the team's consistent performance across diverse conditions.

title: Meghalaya murder case: Autopsy report reveals how Raja Raghuvanshi was killed
content: Raja Raghuvanshi was murdered during his honeymoon in Meghalaya, with the autopsy revealing he died from sharp weapon injuries. His wife, Sonam, and three accomplices have been arrested after confessing to a murder-for-hire plot. The investigation is ongoing, with police recovering a machete and pursuing further leads in the case.

title: 'Free of cost': EC counters Rahul Gandhi's voter roll demand on Maha polls
content: Following Rahul Gandhi's repeated attacks, the Election Commission (EC) has advised him to download Maharashtra voter rolls from its website for free. The EC maintains it shares details with recognized parties and refuted Gandhi's allegations of "match-fixing" in the electoral process, calling them absurd.

title: Mumbai train tragedy: Railways to redesign coaches; what are the new features?
content: Following a tragic train accident in Maharashtra, the Railway Minister and railway board officials are implementing significant design changes for new non-AC trains. These modifications include louvred doors, roof-mounted ventilation, and vestibules to improve ventilation and passenger movement. The first redesigned train is expected to be ready by November 2025 and operational by January 2026 after testing.

title: 11 years of PM Modi: BJP chief hails shift from ‘politics of appeasement’ to 'performance'
content: BJP President JP Nadda asserted that Prime Minister Narendra Modi's 11 years in power have transformed Indian politics, shifting the focus from appeasement to performance and accountability. He highlighted the government's inclusive development approach, outreach to marginalized communities, and bold decisions like abolishing Triple Talaq. Nadda also emphasized India's economic progress and proactive governance during crises like the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Honeymoon horror: Meghalaya Police takes custody of Sonam Raghuvanshi in UP
content: Sonam Raghuvanshi, accused of plotting her husband's murder during their honeymoon, has been taken into custody by Meghalaya police from Uttar Pradesh. Three individuals have already been arrested, confessing to being hired by Sonam to kill Raja. The autopsy revealed Raja died from injuries inflicted by a sharp weapon, with a machete recovered nearby.

title: 160-million-year-old blue-stain fungi in China found to be harmful to trees
content: In a remarkable find, 160-million-year-old blue-stain fungi fossils have been unearthed in China's Jurassic Tiaojishan Formation. This discovery, detailed in ScienceDaily, rewrites the timeline of these fungi, pushing their known existence back by 80 million years. The well-preserved hyphae, found in petrified conifer wood, showcase the fungi's ancient relationship with plants and insects, offering insights into Jurassic-era ecosystems.

title: 'Stabbed her 13 times': B'luru techie kills lover, mother of 2 at hotel; arrested
content: In Bengaluru, Harini R, a 33-year-old woman, was found murdered in a hotel room. Police have arrested Yashas, 25, her alleged lover, in connection with the crime. Harini, married with two children, had been in an extramarital affair with Yashas. The murder occurred after Harini told Yashas she could no longer continue the relationship.

title: Bengals star Trey Hendrickson gets strong support from JD Vance amid contract buzz
content: Cincinnati Bengals' Trey Hendrickson's contract situation gains attention as Vice President JD Vance publicly supports him, calling him a 'generational talent.' Vance's endorsement highlights Hendrickson's value to the team, given his consistent performance with 17.5 sacks in each of the last two seasons. The Bengals face pressure to extend Hendrickson's contract, balancing financial management with retaining a key player.

title: ITR filing: Got a notice? Top types of tax notices & actions required
content: As the ITR filing season for FY 2024-25 begins, understanding potential Income Tax Department notices is crucial. Ignoring deadlines or inaccuracies in 26AS & AIS can lead to penalties. Prompt action, accurate documentation, and expert consultation when needed are essential for a stress-free compliance.

title: Honeymoon murder twist: 'Sonam suddenly surfaced', say cops; reveal details of arrested 'hitmen'
content: Meghalaya Police clarified that Sonam Raghuvanshi voluntarily surrendered at Nandganj Police Station in Ghazipur, Uttar Pradesh, in connection with the honeymoon murder case. She is currently under the safe custody of the Uttar Pradesh Police, and legal procedures are being followed for her transit and formal statement, as confirmed by Deputy CM Prestone Tynsong.

title: 'They’re here for a reason' - Steve Smith on why South Africa can’t be taken lightly
content: Steve Smith anticipates a challenging contest against South Africa's formidable pace attack, spearheaded by Kagiso Rabada and Marco Jansen, in the World Test Championship final at Lord's. Despite Australia being favorites, Smith acknowledges the Proteas' strength. He also reflects on his own successful record at Lord's, while noting the unique challenges the ground presents.

title: LA riots: Newsom blames Trump admin for inciting violence
content: California Governor Gavin Newsom has condemned the Trump administration's deployment of 2,000 National Guard troops to Los Angeles, accusing them of escalating tensions amid immigration protests. Newsom asserts that Trump is manufacturing a crisis, while the administration claims local authorities have lost control.

title: Veteran Brad Marchand might end Toronto Maple Leafs' playoff dilemma—but at what cost?
content: Brad Marchand, a veteran player, may become a free agent. The Toronto Maple Leafs are considering signing him. Marchand has a history of playoff success. He also expressed support for the Leafs in his childhood. The Leafs must weigh Marchand's potential impact against his age and contract demands. The team needs to decide if he is worth the risk.

title: Software exports of STPI-Hyderabad units rose 15% to over ₹1.42 lakh crore in FY25
content: STPI-Hyderabad Directorate has been instrumental in nurturing the IT industry and tech startup ecosystem in Andhra Pradesh and Telangana

title: Hyderabad malls open sans occupancy certificate, GHMC looks away
content: There are several instances of large commercial buildings, including malls and multiplexes, operating without necessary clearances, such as the mandatory Occupancy Certificate

title: Court pulls up Tihar jail authorities for missing security files of AgustaWestland accused
content: The remarks came after the Tihar authorities submitted in the court that the original report sought by the court was “not traceable despite best efforts”.

title: Centre meets Kuki-Zo groups, discusses opening of highways, surrender of weapons
content: At the meeting, the insurgent groups were conveyed about ground rules violations and were also asked to shut down or relocate camps close to the Meitei-inhabited areas

title: Bengaluru stampede | Lessons to be learnt, may come up with act for gatherings, says D.K. Shivakumar
content: Karnataka Deputy CM plans to bring in an Act for future public gatherings after tragic stampede and criticises Opposition politicizing the issue

title: Indian man facing difficulties at Newark airport, Indian Consulate in touch with authorities
content: A video, posted online by an Indian-American social entrepreneur, Kunal Jain, shows the Indian man pinned to the ground by Port Authority Police and being handcuffed.

title: Punjab to set up robust rehab system as more addicts come forward
content: The sub-committee has also directed the Health Department to submit a comprehensive proposal within a week for recruitment of all necessary health staff, he added.

title: Manoj Jha questions Centre’s intentions for caste census
content: The RJD leader says the BJP-led government only wants to create confusion in the name of caste census, questions the reason behind govt. deciding to not release population figures of OBCs

title: PM Modi to visit Cyprus, Croatia during his trip to Canada
content: The visit to Cyprus is seen as a message to Türkiye, which had assisted Pakistan during Operation Sindoor; the stopover at Croatia is important in the context of India-Middle East-Europe Economic Corridor

title: West Bengal BJP holds rally over TMC leader’s ‘vile’ remarks on women
content: The BJP leadership led by Suvendu Adhikari organised a Nari Samman Yatra  in Bolpur. In a viral audio the TMC leader is heard abusing and threatening the police officer using vile language not only against him but also his wife and mother

title: MHA sanctions additional ₹25 crore for over 2,000 homes and properties destroyed in Pakistani shelling in Punjab, J&K
content: Modi announces additional compensation of ₹2 lakh for each fully damaged house and ₹1 lakh for each partially damaged house

title: Kharge backs Rahul Gandhi’s call for electoral transparency in Maharashtra
content: Congress says EC’s credibility at stake; welcomes possible move to publish voter rolls for Maharashtra, Haryana

title: Still-too-early MLB All-Stars: AL, NL roster predictions and biggest debates
content: Freddie Freeman vs. Pete Alonso? Tarik Skubal vs. Kris Bubic? Here's our one-month-out look at who will make it to Atlanta.

title: Packers cut CB Alexander after contract impasse
content: The Packers have released two-time Pro Bowl cornerback Jaire Alexander after the sides couldn't come to an agreement on a revised contract.

title: Colts formalize transition to Irsay's daughters
content: In accordance with their father's wishes, Jim Irsay's three daughters have officially assumed co-ownership of the Colts.

title: Conference bosses bullish on NIL enforcement
content: College conference commissioners are bullish on their ability to enforce NIL rules in a new system days after a multibillion-dollar legal settlement changed college athletics by allowing schools to directly pay their athletes.

title: Source: Bengals to release longtime LB Pratt
content: The Cincinnati Bengals will release longtime linebacker Germaine Pratt, a source confirmed to ESPN. Although the Bengals will incur a $2.3M dead cap charge with the 29-year-old's release, they will gain $5.9M in cap savings.

title: Fever's Clark ramping up for return but out Tues.
content: Caitlin Clark will miss Tuesday's game against the Atlanta Dream as she continues to rehab from a quad strain.

title: Judge homers off Red Sox rookie after jab at Yanks
content: Aaron Judge hit one of his two home runs Sunday night off Red Sox rookie Hunter Dobbins, whose recent comment that he'd rather retire than play for New York made waves. As Judge said, "I've only heard Ken Griffey say that, so I was a little surprised."

title: Inaugural Vitale event to feature Duke vs. Texas
content: ESPN and the Charlotte Sports Foundation have announced an annual men's college basketball event to honor Hall of Fame broadcaster Dick Vitale. The inaugural game, featuring the Texas Longhorns and Duke Blue Devils, will take place on Nov. 4.

title: U.S. Open tiers: Ranking every player in the field at Oakmont
content: Can anyone stop Scottie Scheffler? Will Rory McIlroy find his game? We break down the U.S. Open field at Oakmont from the clear favorites all the way to the players looking to make the cut.

title: 2025 NBA Finals: NBA experts debate Thunder-Pacers Game 3 storylines, what's next
content: The Thunder evened the series on Sunday with a win over the Pacers. Here's what to watch heading into Game 3.

title: OTA no-shows to minicamp holdouts? Intel on key players who skipped offseason work
content: Several key players, such as Haason Reddick and T.J. Watt, missed OTAs, but this week's camp isn't voluntary. Will they show?

title: Inside the numbers: Where Connor McDavid, Leon Draisaitl rank as an all-time playoff duo
content: Edmonton's superstars are climbing the record books this postseason, passing legends on a near-nightly basis.

title: 'The best show in town': Dan Mullen wants to win in style at UNLV
content: After spending a few years on TV, the coach is back at the helm of a college program and looking to make a statement.

title: The Big Two? This Alcaraz-Sinner rivalry is epic
content: Sinner and Alcaraz have combined to win the last six Grand Slams -- and are pushing each other to new heights in the sport.

title: NCAA athlete pay: Here's what's next
content: Schools will begin directly paying their athletes in less than a month, thanks to a legal settlement that was officially approved in federal court Friday. However, the situation is far from settled.

title: Who won the men's transfer portal? Let's rank the 13 best teams
content: These teams got the best players from the transfer portal -- with some familiar faces in the mix for top spot.

title: After Copa América 'disaster,' FIFA is using Club World Cup to be ready for 2026
content: Players slammed the pitch conditions in the U.S. for the Copa América. FIFA is making sure the Club World Cup and 2026 World Cup are different.

title: Ronaldo to stay at Al Nassr? 'Nothing will change'
content: Cristiano Ronaldo has ended speculation regarding his future by confirming he will remain at Al Nassr.

title: Lewandowski: Poland boss 'betrayed my trust'
content: Robert Lewandowski says he feels betrayed by coach Michał Probierz and that it will be difficult to forget the events which led to him stepping away from Poland.

title: Sources: Spurs hopeful of naming Frank as coach
content: Tottenham Hotspur are increasingly hopeful of appointing Thomas Frank as their new head coach, sources have told ESPN.

title: Man City complete $42.2M deal for LB Aït-Nouri
content: Manchester City have completed the signing of Wolves' left-back Rayan Aït-Nouri, the club have announced.

title: Inter Milan name Chivu to replace Inzaghi
content: Inter Milan appointed Romanian Cristian Chivu as coach on Monday on a two-year deal in place of Simone Inzaghi who left the role following the Italian side's 5-0 Champions League final loss to Paris Saint-Germain.

title: Lenglet exits Barça, signs 3-year deal with Atlético
content: Clément Lenglet has joined Atlético Madrid after reaching an agreement to terminate his contract with Barcelona.

title: Doja Cat, J Balvin and Tems in CWC halftime show
content: American rapper Doja Cat, Colombian singer J Balvin and Nigerian singer Tems will headline the Club World Cup final halftime show at MetLife Stadium.

title: UFC 316 clears the way for much-anticipated bantamweight showdowns
content: Two blockbuster fights seem imminent for the UFC 316 main card winners, while next steps for the losers are murkier.

title: Stanley Cup Final odds: Sam Bennett gains ground in Conn Smythe odds
content: Top ways to bet the series and props for the Stanley Cup Final between the Florida Panthers and Edmonton Oilers.

title: Waiver wire: A pair of Blue Jays deserve your attention
content: Tristan H. Cockcroft outlines who should be claimed off the waiver wire and who should be dropped from fantasy rosters.

title: Kate Martin has arrived, Odyssey Sims thriving
content: Kate Martin has become a key scoring specialist for the Valkyries that could prove rewarding in fantasy while Odyssey Sims continues to break out in Los Angeles.

title: Transfer trends: Portugal-to-Prem pipeline, Italy is Europe's retirement home
content: Diving into 2,000 transfers, ESPN's Bill Connelly identifies the good, the bad and the ugly market trends since 2015.

title: Portugal's impressive Nations League win over Spain outshines Ronaldo vs. Yamal
content: Portugal's collective quality won the day -- and the headlines -- over Spain's impressive young talent.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal plan fresh talks over €100m Šeško deal
content: Arsenal have scheduled another round of talks over signing RB Leipzig striker Benjamin Šeško. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: After series of accidents, DGCA to review Char Dham yatra helicopter operations
content: The aviation safety regulator barred Kestrel Aviation from providing chopper services, pending inquiry into a mishap on June 7 in Rudraprayag district

title: Mamata Banerjee holds meet on COVID preparedness, says there is no reason to panic
content: Public health facilities in State are ready to help affected persons with any medical issues, she says

title: Congress defector given top party post by TMC
content: Malakar represented the Matigara Naxalbari Assembly seat for two terms in 2011 and 2016 and is a prominent Scheduled Caste leader

title: Health dept. reiterates steps to prevent COVID-19 transmission
content: Masking in public places as well as in closed spaces like auditoriums and maintaining cough etiquette are important to prevent the transmission. Those with comorbidities asked to strictly adhere to masking mandate

title: Tiger mauls temple caretaker to death in Ranthambore Fort
content: Officials yet to determine which tiger was involved in the incident; locals accuse Forest Department of negligence and demand compensation for victim’s family

title: 21,887 students given Plus One admission in second allotment
content: In all, 2,43,155 of the 4,63,686 applicants get allotment; 75,419 seats left vacant for 2,20,531 applicants

title: Killed in Sikkim landslide, soldier flown home to Lakshadweep 2,500 km away
content: The Army, Air Force, and the Navy coordinated the final journey of Sepoy Sainudheen P.K. from the disaster site at an altitude of 9,000 feet in Sikkim’s Mangan district to a little above sea level in Lakshadweep

title: Calcutta High Court questions State over honorarium for sacked non-teaching staff
content: Justice Amrita Sinha seeks clarity on public spending for staff dismissed in tainted 2016 recruitment; reserves order

title: Indian astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla’s mission to International Space Station postponed once again
content: Once docked, the Ax-4 astronauts will spend about 14 days aboard the space station conducting microgravity research, technology demonstrations, and outreach events

title: Students without UID not to be counted in sixth working day headcount
content: A student without a UID could be enrolled in some other school and this could lead to counting the student twice while determining headcount to determine the number of staff positions in an academic year.

title: Delhi High Court seeks reply over constitution of 15th Press Council
content: The Mumbai Press Club filed a petition stating that the term of the 14th Press Council ended on October 8, 2024 but the new Press Council had not been constituted yet even as it has been eight months

title: MEIL’s sub-contract to Bauer Group to construct Polavaram project diaphragm wall done with CWC approval: Minister
content: The diaphragm wall is being built after it collapsed during the Godavari floods in 2021, as recommended by the experts and the CWS

title: LDF, UDF continue blame game over boy’s tragic death
content: LDF stages a protest outside Vazhikkadavu panchayat office, while UDF organises a march to the Kerala State Electricity Board office, each trying to pin the responsibility on the other

title: Kottayam’s high-ranges to get automated landslide warning system
content: Project proposes to develop an integrated landslide early warning system using electrical, electronic, fiber-optic, and weather sensors, as well as mathematical models

title: Govt. working to turn A.P. into knowledge hub, says Revenue Minister
content: Angani Satya Prasad says government is working to bring changes in the curriculum from KG to PG and credits Minister for Education N. Lokesh of trying to put the education system back on track in the State

title: Congress challenges Centre to present development record on global indices
content: Harshvardhan Sapkal questions Modi government’s performance over 11 years, cites gaps in job creation, farmer welfare

title: Steps being taken to increase milk production in T.N.: Minister
content: Mano Thangaraj and Siva V. Meyyanathan unveiled the foundation for construction of a milk chilling plant at a cost of ₹24 lakh at Kottaikaadu panchayat in Karambakudi panchayat union

title: Initiate dialogue with Maoists: Left parties in joint appeal to PM
content: The Left parties urged the government to respond to the Maoist declaration of unilateral ceasefire and initiate a dialogue to resolve all issues.

title: Temporary solution to supply crisis at SCTIMST
content: Institute enters into an interim agreement with HLL Lifecare Ltd. which will procure and supply the required high-end cath lab materials. The supply shortage had had resulted in a total halt to all neuro interventional procedures in the institute

title: State looks for insurance compensation in ship accident case
content: State government is of the view that there is no need to file an immediate criminal case against shipping company in connection with the ship accident. Government is looking for adequate insurance compensation through negotiation. A decision in this regard was taken at a meeting between Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan and Director General of Shipping recently

title: 240 ITI students participate in skill training initiative for job opportunities abroad
content: Through language and cultural training, the initiative launched by APSSDC, empowers India’s skilled and semi-skilled workforce to succeed internationally, particularly in Germany

title: Rationalisation of polling booths with over 1,200 voters to enhance accessibility
content: Chief Electoral Officer says training of officials in election laws, IT and other aspects is mandatory

title: For trapped predator and prey, instinct to survive overrules impluse to hunt: experts
content: Tiger and dog stuck in pit for hours, tiger released into Periyar Tiger Reserve after shared survival experience.

title: A.P.’s Quantum Valley should have a distinct identity like Silicon Valley, CM tells officials
content: Quantum Mission is being implemented in two phases with an investment of ₹4,000 crore, says Chandrababu Naidu

title: Naidu inaugurates Vision Action Plan Units in 26 districts, 175 constituencies in A.P.
content: Event marks a formal launch of ‘Swarna Andhra 2047’ vision, each unit will have a team of nine members, and ₹10 lakh has been allocated per office for its operations, says Chief Minister

title: Modi government weakened autonomy of constitutional institutions in past 11 years: Congress
content: The Congress chief accused the Modi government of “stealing people’s mandate, toppling governments through the back door, imposing one-party dictatorship and weakening the federal structure”

title: Air India shores up revenue to record level, cuts losses

title: NBA Finals betting: Thunder huge title favorites after blowout win

title: Sources: City closing on $45.6M deal for Cherki

title: Racket Rafael Nadal used to win 2017 French Open sells for $157,333
content: a racket used by Rafael Nadal during his 2017 French Open final sold at a Prestige Memorabilia auction for $157,333.20 including buyer's premium on Sunday . the previous record was a Racket he used during the 2022 Australian Open . in 2017, he defeated Stan Wawrinka in straight sets, 6-2, 6-3, 6-1, for his record-extending 10th french Open title .

title: SGA leads Thunder to Game 2 bounce-back
